alert.note: Alert for Hendry; Inland Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Hendry and southwestern Palm Beach Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 9 miles northwest of Rotenberger Wildlife Refuge, or 14 miles southwest of Lake Harbor. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Hendry and southwestern Palm Beach Counties. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
